statement: Prove that there is one and only one triangle whose side lengths are consecutive integers and one of whose angles is twice as large as another.
Find all natural numbers \(x\) such that the product of their digits equals \(x^2 - 10x - 22\).

Consider the cyclic system \(x_{i+1} = a x_i^2 + b x_i + c\) (\(i = 1,\ldots,n\), \(x_{n+1}=x_1\)) with \(a \neq 0\) and \(\Delta = (b-1)^2 - 4ac\). Prove: (a) if \(\Delta < 0\), no solution; (b) if \(\Delta = 0\), exactly one solution; (c) if \(\Delta > 0\), more than one solution.
Prove that in every tetrahedron there is a vertex such that the three edges meeting there have lengths which are the sides of a triangle.

Let \(f\) be real-valued satisfying \(f(x+a) = \frac{1}{2} + \sqrt{f(x) - f(x)^2}\) for some constant \(a > 0\) and all \(x\). (a) Prove \(f\) is periodic. (b) For \(a = 1\) exhibit a non-constant example.

For every natural number \(n\) evaluate the infinite sum \(\lfloor n/2 \rfloor + \lfloor (n+1)/4 \rfloor + \lfloor (n+2)/8 \rfloor + \cdots + \lfloor (n+2^k)/2^{k+1} \rfloor + \cdots\) (square brackets denote floor function).
